title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Ninety-seven cats rescued from a 1200-square-foot apartment in Woonsocket, Rhode Island by RISPCA.
Some rescued cats are pregnant and most are in good condition, but some have colds needing treatment.
RISPCA seeks donations for supplies and medical care via their item wishlist or through Venmo and PayPal.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran may get more reps at DH for Red Sox as outfield competition increases.
Duran hasn't heard from the team about being primary DH but is willing to adapt to any role.
Duran's name appeared in trade rumors but he remains unconcerned, trusting the process.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins defenseman Jordan Harris hosts clinic for SCORE Boston, aiming to make hockey more accessible to youth.
Harris launches 'Harris’ Huskies' program in partnership with Dorchester nonprofit SCORE Boston to support underserved children.
SCORE Boston, supported by NHL and Bruins grants, provides free equipment, ice time, and instruction for aspiring hockey players.

title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Simmons predicts Jayson Tatum will return to play for the Celtics around March 1 or March 6.
NBC's broadcast of the Celtics vs. 76ers game on March 1 has moved to primetime, fueling speculation of Tatum's return.
Jayson Tatum participated in a 5-on-5 practice session and is ahead of schedule in his Achilles injury rehab.

title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: State Police trooper injured in Salisbury highway crash after a car hit his cruiser on I-95 South.
Trooper and driver Josue Levi Cuevas Santana hospitalized; Santana charged with negligent operation and related offenses.
Trooper released from Portsmouth Regional Hospital; incident highlights dangers faced by highway workers, per State Police.

title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel became the first women's hockey player to record three shutouts in a single Olympic tournament.
Team USA defeated Sweden 5-0 in the semifinals, advancing to the gold-medal game against Canada.
Frankel maintains a .985 save percentage, allowing only one goal on 68 shots during the Olympic tournament.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A woman died after falling through ice at First Encounter Beach in Eastham on Feb. 14, officials report.
Search for the woman's husband, who likely also fell through the ice, was suspended after extensive efforts.
Officials are withholding the couple's names at the family's request, while the dog was safely retrieved by relatives.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded from the Boston Red Sox to the San Francisco Giants in June 2025 after positional disputes.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner expressed disappointment in Devers' reluctance to play first base after a teammate's injury.
Red Sox president Sam Kennedy admitted hindsight would change the handling of Devers' position change prior to his trade.

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Kennedy addressed speculation about the Red Sox's commitment to winning, stating the organization is still passionate about success.
Rafael Devers' trade to San Francisco followed his dissatisfaction with being moved to DH after Alex Bregman's arrival.
Alex Bregman signed a five-year deal with the Cubs after one season with the Red Sox, despite potential no-trade clause issues.

title: 3 dead, 3 injured in shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three dead, including shooter, and three injured in a family-related shooting at Lynch Arena, Pawtucket, during a hockey game.
Shooter Robert Dorgan, also known as Roberta Esposito, targeted relatives; two adult victims dead, three in critical condition.
Pawtucket authorities and Rhode Island police continue investigations; community offers support, and over 100 witnesses interviewed.
